docs.snippet: Liquor advertisers and agency executives will be invited to a meeting here next week to consider the problem of advertising regulation simplification and to submit a program to State liquor administrators, according to William Margolies, publisher of...
docs.lead_paragraph: Liquor advertisers and agency executives will be invited to a meeting here next week to consider the problem of advertising regulation simplification and to submit a program to State liquor administrators, according to William Margolies, publisher of the American Wine Liquor Journal.

docs.snippet: In the face of President Roosevelt's demand for a Congress favorable to his policies, Senator Bennett Champ Clark of Missouri insisted today on his right of political independence. Opening his campaign for Democratic renomination in this "Lead Belt"...
docs.lead_paragraph: In the face of President Roosevelt's demand for a Congress favorable to his policies, Senator Bennett Champ Clark of Missouri insisted today on his right of political independence. Opening his campaign for Democratic renomination in this "Lead Belt" city, where he delivered the first address in his successful bid for office in 1932, Mr. Clark asserted:

headline.main: SENATOR CLARK FIRM FOR INDEPENDENCE; Opening Missouri Campaign, He Defends Opposition to President

docs.snippet: The democratic republican form of government won its second important victory of this year in South America last Sunday with the inauguration of General Alfredo Baldomir as President of Uruguay. The first recent victory has been signalized by the...
docs.lead_paragraph: The democratic republican form of government won its second important victory of this year in South America last Sunday with the inauguration of General Alfredo Baldomir as President of Uruguay. The first recent victory has been signalized by the inauguration of Roberto M. Ortiz as President of Argentina in February.

headline.main: DEMOCRACY ON RISE IN SOUTH AMERICA; Presidents Pledged to Rule by the People Now Installed in Argentina and Uruguay Important Development SYMBOL TO RUSSIA Russia's speed-up system, named after Alexei Stakhanoff, is now broadening its aims.

byline.original: By JOHN W. WHITESpecial Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES
